Reviews.Title: “Mold smelling rooms and terrible dinner.”
Reviews.Author: slopeh
Reviews.Content: We spent one night there with the possibility to stay another, if we liked the place. After settling in our room we noticed a horrible mold smell, that got even worse when you turned on the incredibly noisy air condition. Outside the view was quite nice, but the beach and the ocean floor was very rocky, so we would recommend wearing shoes. We saw some glas splinters there as well. For dinner we had to order one hour in advance, for the kitchen to prepare the food. We ordered the Red Snapper and the chicken breast. Both meals were very tasteless, and far from appealing. Possible the worst meal we have had here in P.R. My girlfriend also got a stomach ache from the poorly cooked chicken. In other words, we left the very next day.. The staff there was quite nice and helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “FUN ON THE CARIBBEAN”
Reviews.Author: Treadman46
Reviews.Content: Location is a little hard to find. Located on a fairly busy highway (3) but the rooms are just a few feet from the ocean. There is some nice sandy areas for lying in the sun however the beach area is very rocky. We love have the windows open at night listening to the ocean waves crashing on shore. The resort also has several hammocks for those just wanting some good R&R. There is a breakfast included but it does not include much and the breakfast purchase options are very limited. Coffee is only available during breakfast hours and there are no coffee makers in rooms. The open air Restaurant has much larger choices for lunch and dinner and optional off site restaurants are at least 15 minutes away. If you are just looking for a place to kick back and relax, this is your place. If you need a lot of activities, better look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: megzilla
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at Caribe Playa Beach Resort and I thought it was great! I am baffled by the negative reviews. I don't understand what people expect for $100/night. Clearly it's not the Ritz Carlton but it exceeded my expectations for the price range. Yes, the rooms are a little dated, but the property is well maintained by an attentive and sweet staff. I noticed the same woman waiting tables in the hotel's restaurant and cleaning rooms - it's a small staff but they are very accommodating and eager to please. The beach right outside the rooms is a bit rocky, but the entire coastline in that general area is rocky. There are sandy beaches for those willing to walk or drive a bit. Alternately, you could enjoy the hotel's small but clean pool area that overlooks the ocean. There are many hammocks available for guests and numerous beach chairs as well. The whole atmosphere is very relaxing! The restaurant doesn't have a huge selection, but everything we had was very good. Overall, this was a wonderful place to stay in Patillas, as long as you bring reasonable expectations! :)

Reviews.Title: “Simply paradise, except breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Travelman-Tx
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this small hotel on the beach. (room 312) Rooms are simple (with AC) and clean. The best thing about this hotel is just that it is right on the white sandy beach with astonishing views of the ocean ! Free breakfast is a downer since it is not a real breakfast but only coffee and toast. The extra French Toast we ordered with fresh coconut were however great ! If you want to get away from it all (really away) and spend time in a simple hotel in a super location, this is a grdeat place ! Super friendly staff also !

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice place”
Reviews.Author: RussellNewYork
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Caribe Playa Beach Resort and I really can't understand the negative reviews. This is a nice, simple, budget hotel in a spectacular location - if you don't mind being off the beaten track. It is tranquil and secluded and other than swimming and lying around in a hammock there isn't much to do but that was exactly what we wanted. Staff is very gracious and accomodating but everything is done slowly - which I think kind of added to the relaxing atmosphere. Rooms are simple, maybe a little run-down, but for the price we paid we were certainly not expecting luxury. Beach and pool were perfectly clean, grounds are beautiful. The dogs are kind of funny - there were just two very well-fed, well behaved mutts about the size of beagles that always hung around together. A fancier hotel would have kicked them out but to me they just added to the charm. Restaurant was completely adequate - again, nothing fancy but it was good. We went to two excellent restaurants nearby - both of which looked like total dives from the front - Restaurant Mufasa and Lorimar (or something like that.)

Reviews.Title: “RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: pepo63
Reviews.Content: professional staff,clean rooms,friendly attention.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting!”
Reviews.Author: TravlerMarshfield
Reviews.Content: Don't let some of the previous reviews scare you off! We just returned and enjoyed our stay very much. No it is not a fancy resort but for about 100 bucks a nite you can't expect that. We had a couple issues with our room, the cable box did not work and we had a solid clear panel over our window instead of screens. If was fixed right away for us. There are 3 dogs that live there, but if you notice there are stray dogs every where you go in puerto rico. The dogs did not have mange, I would have to say they did have fleas though. They were very gentle and friendly dogs, in fact I fell in love with the little female and would have taken her home in a heartbeat if I could have. They could use a little medical care, she did have a small sore on her pad of the foot and in need of nail clippings. There was no dog poop anyplace that I saw. The food is ok and not a huge selection but reasonable priced. Service is very slow. Dinner reservations are required but after you are seated it was usually still an hour wait, not sure why they wanted reservations when your food was never prepared ahead of time like they mentioned. The resort is small and was very quiet. If you are looking for a quiet relaxing not busy spot then this is perfect for you. We very much enjoyed sitting around the pool area, there are a lot of shaded areas if you want to get away from the sun. The beach is very rocky, there are a few open sandy areas that I laid out on to enjoy the water. My husband fished from the shore and caught a few fish. There are plenty of lounge chairs and hammocks to enjoy. Didn't have to fight for one like you do the large resorts. We did not see any roaches or bugs, just a few of those tiny little ants outside on the balcony, none in the room. Lots of cute little lizzards around. Our room was clean, yes outdated and certaily could use some new paint and a few repairs. Housekeeping was great everyday with clean towels and basic cleaning. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. It appeared that a new owner or manager was there for a few days and repairs were started, so maybe there will be some good upgrades in the near future. The view alone is well worth the stay. If you want a fancy resort with lots of extras then stay in busy Puerto Rico. If you are looking for a relaxing, laid back, non tourist spot this place works. We drove through San Juan, I would never imagine wanting to stay in such a busy area. Wi Fi is only available in the dining/bar area but that was no problem. Usually very few people in there and staff was always great to offer a drink or snack. Other guests were very friendly and with such a small resort you ran into them often, always a conversation or smile. If you don't want to drive far the only other eating option we found was a place right down the road. Food was decent and priced fair. Staff there was very friendly also. Don't be afraid to stay here! If there is a problem let them know and they will help you out I am sure. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A good little known place for tranquility”
Reviews.Author: MyrnaPedraza
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this parador since 1996, because its proximity to family . We have seen improvements each time we stay. It has been consistently clean and the staff have been great. Their restaurant offers a limited but good menu.Their room rates and services are very reasonable. They now offer massages. Laura, the masseuse, is very good. Nothing better than a massage by the ocean.This is a tranquil place very little night life. The beach is good for surfing not really swimming beach. There is a pool with plans for an infinity salt water pool. All the rooms face the ocean. There are hammocks and chaises, as well as, b-bque pits on the beach. During the 3 nights we stayed we didn't see any evidence of roaches. Not luxurious but a good value for your money. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “No good 2011...”
Reviews.Author: Tatyana85
Reviews.Content: We vacation in PR a couple times a year. This one and only time we decided to stay local close to family and friends. This hotel-because it's not a resort of any kind was the worst. We're puerto ricans BTW-We didn't expect the Ritz but never thought it would be a roach infested place.If you want to deal with roaches,coffee maker and no coffe,smelly musty rooms,terrible coffe at the restaurant,food terrible,staff friendly but not needed, toilet paper missing and hell to get any,towels are not clean smelling,please bring shoes for walking on a rocky rocky beach not meant for swiming this we knew...... Over all I was switch from one room to another while I was NOT even present.The next room was no better.TV never worked not even in the initial room. When they say free WFI the average person is thinking in the confort of the room-wrong it's only available at the restaurant location -very inconvinent.The hotel was aware of our dislikes and discomforts but never appologized. The view is great! the hammaocks are not clean nor ever maintained. If you want a nice windy view this is the place. If you need service plus view and some food swiming please stay in San Juan!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: kiernan7
Reviews.Content: This is a fine little place with a nice, secluded location. All rooms face the ocean and the restaurant is passable and probably the best in the immediate area. It's not 4 star, but you shouldn't be expecting it to be. Nice people working there and even two friendly dogs. We'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENCE”
Reviews.Author: Marie M
Reviews.Content: During Xmas 2011, I spent time with friends at Paradore Caribbean Playa Resort in Patillas, Puerto Rico. It was an absolute delight. 24hrs. a day you hear & see the ocean right beneath your feet. Every room faces the ocean with a wrap around balcony. It's quiet, restful and romantic. Not a place for kids for there's not much to do on sight except spending time with your favorite people. FOOD was creole & absolutely exquisite. Everything was fresh, hands on and very tasteful. Staff was eager to please & very friendly. Lots of time to contemplate as you walk the beach, Simple elegance of life. ENJOY.

Reviews.Title: “Small Quiet Resort That Understands what Tourists Want”
Reviews.Author: Acadia1
Reviews.Content: Great View, Nice little restaurant, very accommodating staff. My experience is that PR is not great for providing a vacation atmosphere for tourists but Caribe Playa is an exception. It was the first stay on my trip where I really felt relaxed. Also very reasonably priced.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Mazzahs
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stop on a trip throughout PR. I've visited PR many times but never ventured to the Southern portion of the island. I looked this place up in my book, "Puerto Rico on a Budget". We considered a few places in the SE sector. While I wasn't looking for a budget-oriented hotel, I was searching for a place that felt less pretentious & populated by tourists. We found just that.... Upon pulling the car in, I was hesitant since the resort is quite small and off of a semi-busy road hugging the coastline. We had read zero reviews on TA and had no idea of relevant rates. We were immediatley taken aback by the astounding views and the near ocean front location. Strike that....this place is near falling into the water! I'm of course being dramatic, but see this while you can because if there is ever a hurricane, this place may be wiped off the map...it's that close to the Caribbean Sea. If you're looking for 4 or 5 star resorts, drive by this place w/ a fury. If you're looking for a reasonably priced, ocean front, quaint, friendly hotel w/ a pool, hammocks, restaurant (owner's Mom may cook here) & clean rooms....look no further. The rooms are dated, but there's hot water, a fridge, small kitchenette (no stove) & a view. Did I mention the view? Yeah, it's that good, especially from the restaurant (this was awesome as well but I won't exacerbate the details here).This is the kind of dive you dream of buying to run or fix up while vacationing in the Caribbean. Yes, this is THAT place. Beach is so-so for enthusiasts, but the views and surf more than make up for this. There was also a surprise drive-by local parade the night we stayed that we watched from the bathroom window! The owners are passionate for your approval and will point you to any place on the island for pleasure. Leave your gripes at the door and kick back to relax in this hidden oasis.... BTW...the cheapest room is around $60/night. We chose a top floor room and paid $90....match that ocean front San Juan/Ponce!

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!”
Reviews.Author: madambaseball
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night as we were traveling the island. This resort literally sits on the beach. We drifted off to sleep to the sound of the waves. We woke up and had breakfast in their restaurant which is right on the beach. From anywhere at this resort, you are never more than 25 feet from the ocean/beach. The room was more than adequate with cold air conditioning, a comfortable bed and a warm shower. The service/hotel mgt is informative and helpful. It's well worth the money. P.S. They are pet friendly and that particularly impressed me (although I wasnt traveling with pets).

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: capetowntraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night,not great experience. Were told that the pool was closed,but we could swim in the sea,it was dark,so not safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: marie14ds
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here for 1 night and it was great. The front desk staff was very friendly and the check in was smooth. The room was spacious and very clean. The shower handle was broken, I went to the front desk to let them know and within minutes it was fixed. The AC was cold. The room had a little table with 2 chairs and a fridge. The one thing that was inconvenient was that you have to order your food one hour before, but it was no big deal we just went to get unloaded in the mean time. Also, the food is very overpriced, we paid 75 $$ for 3 pina coladas, a soda, a rice and beef meal, and 2 hamburgers. But the service were nice. The brekfast was included and we could order anything from the menu at no cost. The view from the restaurant is breathtaking and the room was litterally 2 steps from the beach and there are some hammocks to relax by the beach wich are very nice. Overall a great stay and a very nice upgrade from the other hotel in Patillas that we stayed in (Parador Caribean Paradise.)

Reviews.Title: “4 star outside, 1 star room”
Reviews.Author: rcrary
Reviews.Content: I thought the exterior was gorgeous! Incredibly well maintained. The view was amazing, all we had to do was look out the window and the ocean was right there. We opened our door and we were literally steps from the beach. The food they served was delicious. Our host was very welcoming and the staff was very accomodating. Our room needed updating very badly though. Not just aesthetically either. The shower leaked, the ceiling leaked, the room had a slightly moldy smell, the kitchenette should have been replaced years ago. Also Patillas isn't what I expected. It may be that we were there in the rainy season and everything was closed but there really isn't a whole lot there. We flew into San Juan and drove along Hwy 184 to get to Patillas. The drive was jaw droppingly gorgeous and I would recommend it to anyone. Anyway, the exterior and common areas really are beautiful and maybe there are rooms that have been updated but our room was in need of some help.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: n p
Reviews.Content: Caribe Playa was wonderful for what my boyfriend and I wanted. We were looking to get away and relax and not worry about anything - including driving around. Once we got to the hotel, after getting very lost finding it at night, everything was great. The beach is gorgeous and no one was really there - very secluded. At night we just laid in a hammock or on the beach and drank wine. This is a good place to go and relax, it is not good if you are wanting to see and experience many different things. We only had 4 nights so this was perfect getaway. The restaurant was ok. Breakfast was standard: eggs and bagels, and tasted pretty good. For dinner I had a salad and the chicken tasted like it was heated up in the microwave. There are a few other restaurants that are very close by so for dinner i'd probably stick with one of those. As for the rooms, they are very standard and yes, there were bugs. But that is what we expected. We spent nearly no time in the room except for sleep. The bugs are everywhere here so bring lots of bug spray... even sometimes that didn't work for me. If you are prone to getting eaten that is the one drawback of this place. Other than that I would definitely come back and stay even longer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MSS961
Reviews.Content: We found this place by chance while looking for a restaurant to have dinner. It was around 5 pm and the kitchen was not open yet. However, the hosts were extremely helpful and suggested they will prepare our dinner while we have a swim, and offered us couple of towels. We took their suggestion. It was a magical evening with great food and excellent service, and beautiful view on a Caribbean beach!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: carjunkie412
Reviews.Content: I went to this resort as a last minute trip with a friend for a vacation. We were on a budget hence why we chose this place. The price was totally worth what you pay for. There is no luxury really, but the grounds are beautiful and the views are breathtaking. We rented a car, which really is a must unless you want to be strapped to the resort, where there really is not anything to do except sit on the beach and go to the one restaurant they have. I am not sure I consider it that even since it is literally a kitchen where there is one woman cooking. The food however, is very authentic and fantastic. Since we had the car, we were able to drive to the top of the hill where we ordered some other food that was deleicious as well. The nice thing about this place is that it is ocean front rooms so you wake up to the waves. There is a nice pool area that was kept clean and never a lot of people there to bother you. There are nice hammocks around the grounds of the resort, and beautiful sea glass on the beach to collect. We filled jars and brought them home to our family. It is a great place to go as a couple as well to relax. I The worst negative about this place was how far it was from the airport. If I remember correctly it was at least an hour, but not much more then that. I would definitely go back if there were not other places I want to visit first that I have not been to before. They definitely try to be very accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “Simpley The Best”
Reviews.Author: SamMuncy
Reviews.Content: We did not get to stay at this hotel but we ate there many times and enjoyed the hotel grounds and restaurant and on our next trip we will DEFINITELY stay. That is why we could not fully answer questions about the aminities. But please do not have any hesitations or worries about your visit/stay at the Caribe Playa. We found the grounds and restaurant are clean, romantic and fascinating. The staff is very helpful and so pleasant. If you plan to stay or visit the southern coast of Puerto Rico then you must stop at the Caribe Playa. It is a comfortable, private, well maintained and clean restaurant and lodge. The views of the Caribbean are breath taking and the beach is only for you and other guests that share the maybe 20 rooms all closely facing the ocean. Ask about Goldie/Mimi. She is very friendly and charming. We are very happy to have found this small oasis of comfort and serenity andwill definitely go next to Puerto Rico just to enjoy staying at this place. It goes on our really neat places to stay list.

Reviews.Title: “Great hideaway for a great price, no thrills, but awesome views and staff”
Reviews.Author: rmonroe820
Reviews.Content: Hopefully this review helps settle all the mixed reviews on Caribe Playa. My family, with two kids age 12 and 15 stayed during Thanksgiving week. We wanted to stay at a place that resemebled a bed and breakfast, where we could see the ocean and the mountains and mingle with the regulars. Our last trip to the island was at a really nice resort in Rincon. For this trip, we wanted to mix more with locals and have a stay that was more personal. Caribe Playa supplied all our desires plus some. If you are used to staying in a plush, modern resort, then you probably would not enjoy your stay here. However, if you want a great place to stay with awesome ocean views and have that at home feeling with staff, then this is your place to stay. The ocean is so close, we hardly slept the first night because we were not used to the loud waves coming from the beach. We found the waves relaxing from the second night on. The resort is on a main road and you can hear some traffic at times, but it is not rediculous. You will hear more often the trucks and cars that have loud music playing than anything. We found it humorous, so many locals trying to outdo each other with their music, some really take this serious with huge speakers in their truck bed! The staff was unbelievably nice. I don't know how some people can say the staff was not awesome. I suppose they were really looking for a different place than Caribe Playa. The restaurant is more like a patio over the ocean, quite awesome. Breakfast was really good and for dinner, you have to try the main course for the day. If you try a burrito or burger, you will just be getting something plain. Try some of the specials, you will not be displeased. There are many food places close by as well, including a couple of supermercados. Let me see, what else. Cleanliness. OK, the rooms had some dirt and sand on the floor. We had a faucet that leaked. There were screens and not glass on the windows. But, really, this is not the hilton. I think they should change the name from beach resort to beach bungalow. The room is so close to the ocean, it is hard not to get the floors dirty. You should have seen our room's floor by the time we left. We had a great time outside and as a result, we unintentionally brought it some sand and dirt each time. Beach? - not much of one for laying out. This is not a place to stay if you want to swim at the beach each day. Water is too rough and beach is rocky, but it is very, very pretty. There are areas that do have lots of sand. There are many beaches close by where one can go to swim and lay out if desired. If you want to go shell hunting, the beach to the north of hotel is awesome. We found really nice shells. We found many, almost too many things to do close by. There is Carco Azul up the mountain in Patillas. A very nice park with trails that take you to an awesome, natural water pool. A must see. There is a bakery very close and the owner is very friendly, speaks english and has much more than bakery items. There is also a pizza shop close. We had a fresh hand tossed pizza that was great. If you drive north on 3, there are awesome views of the ocean overlooking the mountain cliffs. A lighthouse is also close. Lastly, the hammocks are really right on the ocean and very relaxing to use. Caribe Playa is not the Hilton, but neither is the price. We will most likely be back sometime after we explore the rest of the island. Gotta mention Bubby too! Our daughter likes animals a lot and she really made friends with the on site puerto rico dog - bubby. If you want a down to earth place to stay with awesome views, then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Gringo's beware - you will be second class guests.”
Reviews.Author: tapeezarf
Reviews.Content: The manager is more interested on talking on his cell phone than taking care of business. The rooms are in poor condition. We had to ask for towels, TOILET PAPER and coffee cups. And that is AFTER we had to change rooms because the water would not work and the windo blinds would not roll up. Beach is fair, especially if you walk it toward town. Snorkeling is pretty good, but dangerous due to undertows. Pool is GREAT. We had to go almost into Patillas to be able to use our cell phones. Patillas is a nice, quaint little town with lots of history. Several decent (not fancy, but good seafood and reasonable prices) close by. W.e would never, ever go back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hide Away!”
Reviews.Author: purchgdss
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Vistas... nothing like lying in the hammocks watching the ocean and the local body boarders. Friendly staff, excellent food (I LOVED the pork chops and the mashed plantains, relaxed atmosphere. Wonderful hide away for a "do nothing but enjoy" vacation. I was tempted not to review them to keep this jewel for myself!

Reviews.Title: “The lowest point of our PR vacation”
Reviews.Author: rmaggid
Reviews.Content: While planning our trip to Puerto Rico, we were looking for a destination to stay the night between traveling from Rincon to Luquillo. We thought about Ponce, but wanted something right on the beach. My girlfriend found this really cute looking place in Patillas, called Caribe Playa. Based on the website, it looked great: white sandy beaches, hammocks, right on the water, romantic restaurant under the stars. We booked it for a night. Arriving in the late afternoon, we were happy to be there and relax beach-side after a long day of getting perpetually lost driving. The check-in/restaurant area was beautiful - open air, peaceful, well designed, clean-looking, etc... The woman at the front desk was very friendly and welcoming. She gave us a 2nd floor room, overlooking the ocean. Upon lugging all the luggage up the 2nd floor and walking in the room, something looked amiss. Upon walking into the bathroom and looking at the room, it appeared it was under construction. The bathroom was completely unfinished, the walls unpainted, construction equipment in the closet, and no screens on the windows. When finished this room seemed like it would be nice. So my girlfriend returned to the front desk to request a different room, for obvious reasons. I waited on the 2nd floor, not wanting to carry the luggage back down, without knowing where to go. She got the new room key and I told her to look at the room and make sure this room was OK, she came back very upset and told me to come with her. I opened the door to the new room and there were 4 cockroaches crawling across the floor. Back to the front desk again. We get another room and were told this is the last one available, which quite frankly is hard to believe since it was the low season and there didn't appear to be anyone around. We walked in this room and this one apparently hadn't been remodeled since the 60's. The floor was a cheap, worn tile - like what you see in a Walgreens . The colors were uncoordinated and faded. The air conditioner was rusty and leaked. The window did not have glass in it behind the shutters, just a cellophane-like material, which seemed to attract a lot of dead bugs on the outside. There were little bugs (nats, I think) crawling all over the bathroom - on the walls, towels, window, etc... There was about a 2in space between the bottom of the front door and the ground - making a nice little entrance for any of the many little crawly creatures to come right in. Had we not been in the middle of nowhere, with a habit of getting perpetually lost on PR roads, we would have left for another hotel. We decided to stay, dosing the entire room, bed, and bathroom in bug repellent and choosing to sleep on top of our beach towels. Upon walking to the restaurant to get a bite to eat, we encountered a dead mouse on the sidewalk. The evening had become almost comical at that point. We decided to take a quick detour to walk on the beach, which was rocky, with old chunks of cement scattered around. The restaurant was nice. The food was good and atmosphere, beautiful. However, we were really in no mood to enjoy it. We loaded up on drinks to fall asleep quicker! The next morning upon checking out and being relieved to have not been bitten by any bedbugs or any other creatures, we noticed that our room had a small sign indicating the prices for the high and low season. This room was priced at $85, while we had paid $120, upon checking in. When we went to the front desk, the manager tried charging us the full amount. We explained the drama of our stay - he never apologized. We told him about the price indicated our room. He frankly responded by saying that no rooms are priced like that. He didn't believe us. He went to check for himself, leaving us standing there. He came back with the sign and acknowledged it. He still never apologized. After what we went through I didn't expect to be refunded just for the price difference, I thought we deserved a complete refund. However, just wanting to leave and with some language barriers, I let it go. The Caribe hell was over.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Secluded Paradise for Two”
Reviews.Author: cambridge232
Reviews.Content: We Stayed 2 nights at this beautiful,clean,and friendly resort. The food was fantastic. Elmo was an exceptional host with great ideas to make our trip memorable. The flowers and grounds were beautiful. Definately will return. The views are beautiful. A must see.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamesrodz
Reviews.Content: On my way to the Festival Jueyero "Crab Festival" In Maunabo I decided to stay over night at a nearby location. Called a friend of mine and suggested the Caribe Playa Hotel since it was his go to place in the area. I called and was attended by Elmo (Manager) who, after a brief interview, worked his way around my budget and got me a small but clean, decent and comfortable beachfront room. The place is quiet, neat and nature friendly. Lots of greens, flowers and palms blend with the sound of the waves to make this place a quiet and relaxing atmosphere. The restaurant has a nice menu with reasonable prices. You will find a big smile in all the staff members and were always there to help when needed. The beach is not the greatest to swim in since the water is a bit choppy but it does have a huge chain of reefs to explore with skin diving equipment. However, if you walk about 50 yards on the beach you will find a better area to swim. It was quite a different atmosphere than what I'm used to, living in the Metro Area. This was my first stay at Caribe Playa Hotel and will defenitely not be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our last night in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Tracy50_10
Reviews.Content: Small ,quaint and romantic. Clean King size room with sm table and chairs. The ocean was wonderful to go to sleep by. Great pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Playa Saved The Day!”
Reviews.Author: sophieloves
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about this hotel, it's manager, the Great Elmo Lugo, and its owners. My friends, family, and I stayed in this hotel the weekend of April 8-12 to celebrate my wedding. I had been planning this wedding for 10 months, and on the night before the wedding, some unfortunate circumstances led us to be forced to switch the wedding venue. Elmo heard about this and jumped to my side to help. By the next morning he had set me up with the miracle worker/event planner, Miriam and her trusted assistant, Wanda and within hours they had planned a more beautiful wedding than I had been able to do in 10 months! We ended up having the cermony and reception in the gorgeous pool area at Caribe Playa and it was perfect! The staff was so gracious and friendly all week and all 40+ of our guests were so impressed. We will all definitely be back. Thank you Caribe Playa!! OH! Also, the food in the restaurant is absolutely delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location,great staff and service....”
Reviews.Author: rafijoe
Reviews.Content: Simple accomodations with just the necessary for a quiet,peaceful mini vacation... their food is very good so is the servive...Elmo and Rosa are exellent hosts. The housekeeping staff very respectful and courteous! We will do this again !!!!!! Plus: "no" internet/cell phone signal...yeah !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Thanksgiving at the Emerald of the South”
Reviews.Author: BrianC14
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Two daughters (11 & 6 ), and I traveled to Patillas PR this past Thanksgiving. Our adventure began after we landed in San Juan. I was excited to get out of city as quickly as possible, after reading some of the nightmarish reviews on the "driving situation" and of course being the adventurous type we rented a car. It was a great drive seeing all of the beauty that PR has to offer. However if you suffer from motion sickness, steer clear of mountainous driving ( my youngest got car sick at least 8 times while there). Traffic wasn't as bad as many people made it out to be (we did travel there in an off season time) however you do need to pay attention and be aware of your surroundings, I'm from Baltimore so aggressive driving is in my blood! If you plan to bring a GPS forget it ! It did help a little, but we got lost every day with two maps and a GPS, but that was the adventure! We finally arrived at our Hotel "The Caribe Playa Beach Resort in Patillas, after 3 pukes from my daughter and getting directions 5 times from the wonderful Manager "Elmo" It was a great location, great staff, friendly people, rooms were adequate (exactly what we wanted, a clean place to sleep. since we would not be in our room much) Food was great, we ate there a couple of times, but mainly checked out local PR spots for grub, and even went to the local market and grilled out at the hotel one night. Our week was filled with early morning sunrise breakfast to finding little empty beaches to call our own for the day! Throughout the week we did see each side of the island and yes even traveled back to San Juan for the day and had a great time, ( one of the shuttle guys from airport gave us a great tip: got to San Juan after Tuesday, that was when all the Cruises left port) we had a great time, our favorite place was Fajardo, it had beautiful beaches, great deli's with homemade sweet breads (Cuban Sandwich was out of this world) We even went back to our favorite beach there for Thanksgiving day and found a road-side vendor selling roasted whole pig and turkey, we got a couple pounds of each and some can sodas and enjoyed our Thanksgiving turkey and pork on a breath taking beach. We as well traveled to El Yunque rain forest, it was amazing and would not miss it. I would suggest this hotel and trip for the adventurous type, not too much bling but alot of natural beauty and secluded wonderful places to see. I cannot wait to return there, I know there is so much more for us to experience

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location with nice restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: QueenOfTheRoad7
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because we wanted to be lazy on the beach for a couple of days, and it worked nicely. There's actually shade on the beach too, which was a plus. Could walk right out of our room 20 steps and be on the beautiful beach. The on-site restaurant was excellent. Make sure you get vouchers if your rate includes breakfast. Our room was fair and was in need of remodeling. The bed wasn't very comfortable and the furnishings were worn out. Of course, we didn't spend much time in our room since the beach was so beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place with excellent service...a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: seasand55
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I have been exploring Puerto Rico trying to find our hideaway from San Juan, and this is it! The hotel is beautiful and the service couldn't be better! The food at the restaurant is very good, and the fact that there isn't much to do in the area just made it even more appealing. If you want to get away from the hectic city life & just be a beach bum, then this is the place to go to. It is a great value, and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we only stayed one night”
Reviews.Author: Fly_2_the_moon
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to see so many positive reviews of this hotel. We stayed one night here when we were driving from the west coast to the east coast of the island, and when I saw the room my heart sank. I was being kind when I called it "rustic" but my boyfriend was being more accurate when he called it "dilapidated." The room was dark, dreary, and dirty and I could not wait to get out of there. I was so glad we didn't have to stay any longer than we did. In fairness, the grounds of the hotel are nice. But, the hotel is located on a small strip of land between a busy road and the ocean so there is a lot of noise from the road. For a comparable price, there are MUCH nicer hotels in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed, nice boutique beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flote
Reviews.Content: I hesitated a long time before booking this hotel and ended up making a last minute reservation. Well, I was not disapointed. The location is right on the beach. If you are looking for a calme area to swim, this may not be the best place as the waters are a bit rought. It did not really matter for us. We just had to step outside of our room to relax at the beach. The hotel is not big, maybe 25 rooms, and has nothing to do with large hotel chains. The service is perfect and much better than in larger hotels. Brreakfast is good and not too expensive. The hotel has a large terrace with view on the ocean which is so relaxing to have you meals. We had diner there which was ok. Nothing fancy, but just ok. Considering the size of the place, you need to place your order 1h in advance, and the menu is kind of limited. But we found what we liked and had a great diner. There is not much around in terms of shops, or restaurant. You need to drive 10-15 minutes to get to the first shop. This hotel is perfect is you want a relaxing place, far from all the noise, traffic and everything else in San Juan. I wish we would have stayed longer. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jorgecab53
Reviews.Content: The best, quiet, comfortable, nonexpensive place to stay. Perfectly friendly staff, specially Oscar, the manager, Maria the roomkeeper, Could not be asking for more (except more time to stay of course) Don't look for luxuries, expect tranquility and true friendly service. I will recommend this place to the whole world. By te way , want a massage to go with your relaxing time? They have somebody over there just for you.

Reviews.Title: “paradise found”
Reviews.Author: rbrown333
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on www.hostel.com and paid $45 through the website to stay one night by myself at this lovely hotel. Trip Advice: I rented a car Charlie's by the airport for $20 a day or $149 for the week. I highly recommend renting or purchasing a GPS if you are driving all over PR as it can be difficult and frustrating without one. Have cash on hand for toll roads. After leaving San Juan in the morning I packed a picnic lunch and drove to El Yunque Rain Forest which took around 30 minutes and then spent the day hiking in the forest, enjoying the views and having a picnic by a waterfall. I then drove 1 hr. to Patillas to this lovely escape by the beach arriving at 5 p.m. After checking in I ordered dinner to be ready at 7 p.m. as they cook to order for dinner and it is recommended to order an hour before you eat. Pros: lovely staff, clean room, cable tv, books to read, refrigerator in room, hot water, air conditioning, ocean view, beach directly in front of room, pool, hammocks, chaise lounge chairs on the beach, calm water, outside bbq, great food $4-10 breakfast and $10 - $20 a meal for lunch and dinner...spent a total of $73 on room, dinner and breakfast (what a deal!!) Cons: not much to do in town, stay at the hotel for everything, no local restaurants or shops Next Day I drove 1hr. to Ponce for the day

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay on the south side”
Reviews.Author: billmyers
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negatives I was a little scard. I'm not sure where these other pepol stayed but my stay was the best. the room was neat, clean and right on the beach. the owner and staff were wonderful and went out of there way to make our stay the best. If you are looking for the fast pased of the big city. Stay in San Juan. This is a place to kick back and relax.

Reviews.Title: “paradise with an awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: smathis1962
Reviews.Content: I do not understand the poor reviews i am seeing for Caribe Playa. This was my second stay at this resort. If you are expecting a 5star resort then you will probably be disappointed but you are not paying for a 5star resort either. The setting- this is one of the most beautiful spots i have found on the island. The hotel is situated on a crescent shaped cove right on theocean. It is probably less than 50 feet from your room door to the water. and in between are numorous coconut palms with hammocks tied between them. BBQ pits if you choose to cook for yourself, and deck lounge chairs. We actually had baby sea turtles right outside our room door one night that we helped back to the sea. Awesome nice freestyle pool that their groundskeeper puts a lot of time and effort into keeping clean. And everywhere is the lush vegetation of the island. The Staff- Oscar, the manager was very helpful and friendly and a pleasure to talk to. The ladies that pulled double duty as housekeeping and waitresses were so incredibly sweet and helpful. They even rememebered us from our prior three day stay 14 months earlier. Even remembered that we had to leave early last year due to my wife's breast cancer and asked how she was doing and was genuinely concerned when i told her my wife had passed away. Try getting that at a 5 star resort!! George and Francis- the owners are wonderful people. I only saw Francis near the end of our stay this year but last year we saw a lot of both her and George. They made it feel more like we were visitors in their home than just hotel guests. The hospitality here is incredible. The food- while a little pricey it is no more expensive than your local appleby's but it is delicious and very filling generous portions. The boys had the penne con pollo and loved it. I chose the carribean pork chop meal with rice and beans the first night and the smashed plantain with chicken in butter and garlic sauce the second night. Both meals were incredibly good. and again- if you dont want to eat their awesome food you can grill steaks or puerto rican sausage for yourself at the bbq pits. The rooms- the rooms are comfortable and clean. nothing fancy but how much time are you going to spend in them anyways? They have cable tv, a wetbar and mini fridge and the airconditioningworked very well in all the rooms we have stayed in. Would be nice to have a small microwave available in the rooms- the only negative i could find. snorkeling is nice here- lots of reefs and fish right outside your door. currents can be strong at times and you should stay within the designated swim areas. The beach is kind of rocky soo wear water shoes or sandals if you are beach combing. Nearby there is a decent grocery store in Patillas ( i beleive plaza grocery) where you can get meat for the grill and pretty much any kind of food items you might need. The texaco near the hotel has a very friendly staff that speaks english very well ( that can be an issue in Patillas if you do not speak much spanish). There are small restaurants within a couple mile drive in either direction from the hotel if you care to venture out. We chose not to as we were please with the food at Caribe Playa. Overall i would highly recommend Caribe Playa as a nice , comfortable place to stay while on the island, with an awesome staff, good food, and nice, clean rooms placed right in the middle of paradise. George, Francis, Oscar and everyone else at Caribe Playa- Thank You for making our stay with you everything it could be! We look forward to staying with you again next year!!

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: M-Michigan
Reviews.Content: Caution - If you are use to having air conditioning then DO NOT stay at this hotel. My wife and I stayed for one night in June and woke in the morning to the air conditioner unit blowing no cool air. We contacted the front desk and were told we would have to speak to the manager who conveniently would not be in until the afternoon and after check out time (we were only planning a one night stay). We had no choice but to shower in a hot room, we then sweated immediately, and then checked out. We called the manager later that day multiple times until we finally got him at 4 pm to complain. He said there was nothing he could do since â€œwe had already checked out.â€� If we had been staying another night he said he would have given us a free meal in the crappy fast restaurant there (oh, what a treat that place was not - not but fast food at high prices). In addition, he said the housekeepers went in an hour after we left and the AC was working. Hmm, I guess it â€œmagicallyâ€� started working. Simply put, if you want or need AIR CONDITIONING, DO NOT stay here. This is nothing but a run down motel pretending to be a â€œresortâ€� quote-unquote. The customer service is non-existent. When we informed the manager we would be posting our compliant online he responded - â€œgo ahead, who cares!â€� Well, hopefully potential future customers will show him who cares. Certainly, if you want AC you will not want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy About Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: LennyK1015
Reviews.Content: While visiting my wife's family in Salinas, we needed a place to stay for 2 nights. After checking Tripadvisor, the closest place to the east(on Rt. #3) was Caribe Playa Beach Resort. The Resort is about 30kms. from Salinas. The ride took about 45 min. on a late Fri. afternoon, but only about 30 min. back on Sun. morning. The dinning room is open air. We had a very nice breakfast with excellent local coffee. The pool is very nice and sized just right for the number of units on site. Caribe Playa Beach Resort is in the middle of nothing. Rt. 3 is a country road, 2 narrow lanes with the ocean on one side and mountains on the other. This is a place to relax. There are charcoal grills outside the rooms that overlook the beach. Hammocks and beach chairs line the resort. We had dinner twice at Cafe Del Mar. This open air restaurant has a full bar and fresh fish nightly. It's at MM 119.2 and overlooks the ocean (Bring Bug Spray). The service is a bit slow, but the food is Excellent. We will return to the Caribe Playa Beach Resort whenever we come to Salinas.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for the weary”
Reviews.Author: msmkrs
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from vacationing in Puerto Rico. The first part of our trip was spent staying at a well known luxury resort, which was very nice, but paled in comparison to the wonderful relaxing experience we had at Caribe Playa. The host/staff were very welcoming and helpful. The rooms, although, very modest were kept clean and had an awesome view. The beautiful and tranquel Caribiean Sea was literally steps from our room. The hammocks and chases provided, also just outside our door, proved to be just what we needed. They also have grills outside the rooms, which we took advantage of after purchasing some fresh caught red snapper form a local fisherman just up the road. We did take advantage of the terrace dining and all the dishes were made to order and delicious. The staff really goes out of the way to make your stay worry free. My advise to anyone wanting to experience a little slice of paradise without alot of hussle and bussle would be to rent a car at the airport and drive directly to Caribe Playa. If the desire to explore arises, anywhere you might want to go on the island is as much fun experiencing the scenery along the way as your destination.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, but out of the way of everything”
Reviews.Author: brandiwos
Reviews.Content: In March for our honeymoon, my husband and I stayed at this hotel. We arrived very late, so the staff put our room key in an envelope and taped it to a wall for us to find. Upon entering our room, we found it pleasent and modest but adequete. It had a small refrigerator, a table, a bed, a tv with stand, couple night stands, a bathroom with a stand up shower. We had room 8 closest to the pool, which happened to be right next to the water tanks. I don't know what they were doing with these water tanks, but water process was running within them, was very loud. The first morning, as soon as we walked out of the door, a vicious dog who was on a leash and belonged to the people next to us, lunged at us. We then proceeded to walk down to the beach to find that it is very rocky and you must have shoes on to walk on it. We went snorkling and we were pleased to find, very very good snorkling at this location, and the water turned out to be the clearest in which we experienced on the island. As far as the room being cleaned everyday, the bed was made but the sand was not washed out of the shower. The eating area was very nice, but the food was not. I ordered Shrimp and Chicken Primavera, and was very disappointed to find that it was exactly the kind that comes out of the Green Giant bags from the supermarket ( I buy them all the time, I could tell) and they charged me 15.95 for it. My husband got a beef steak, which turned out to be cheap cube steak. Don't waste your money, don't eat here. Also, don't buy beer here. Go to Wal-Mart and buy a 12 pack for 9 dollars, instead of 2.50 a beer here. A single cup of coffee is also 1.50. Also, one night at about 11 pm, the grounds people came in and started watering the plants right infront of our door and were spraying the walls with a powerful stream of water, loud enough to be disturbing. This hotel is also, very very far away from anything. It is about an hour drive to Fajardo, and about 2 to San Juan. I think I would stay in Fajardo next time, it took a very long time to get anywhere from the hotel. On a positive note, the grounds were kept very clean, and the sand (what little they had) was raked everyday. The was very little parking in the parking lot. It was fun to walk down the beach with a flash light and look for sea shells, look closely, they are very tiny.

Reviews.Title: “For seekers of beauty, romance, tranquility at very moderate prices, this place can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: rdt4
Reviews.Content: Caribe Playa is the essence of tranquil simplicity â€“ a pure and peaceful tropical beach â€¦ white sand, lapping waves, waving palms At Your Door (in fact, you can see all of them from your bed). A lovely terrace restaurant â€“ again, on the water with kind and accommodating service all â€˜round. If you are seeking quiet authenticity â€¦ a hammock tied between palms â€¦ enveloped in the sights and the sounds of the Caribbean â€¦ this is place for you. If you want flashing action, it is not. We loved Caribe Play and recommend it without reservation. P.S. The little black puppy with the four white paws was a special fun bonus. We hope you will keep him!

Reviews.Title: “Go for the view; plan out the rest of your trip!”
Reviews.Author: pr2009
Reviews.Content: First of all, book this hotel through hostelworld.com. Trust me, you CANNOT beat the prices they offer. I would have been VERY disappointed in this place had I paid the full price. The location: pretty unbeatable. Every room is right on the water, no bad view in the place. However, we did not swim at all at this beach, much too rocky and rough waters. Plan to drive to better beaches. The room: we were promised a phone, wet sink, ceiling fan, and coffee maker. There was no phone. (luckily our cells got plenty of service). There was no counter or wet sink in the room. There was a coffee maker, but not mugs. The biggest disappointment, however, was the lack of a ceiling fan. Because there was no ceiling fan, we were forced to keep the A/C running all night. The A/C machine was so loud, though, that we could not even hear the (fairly loud) surf right outside of our door. Had we had a ceiling fan, the stay would have been much improved. Also, the hot water ran out after about 1/2 of a shower. Yes, this place is right on the road. However, the road is small and there was not much traffic any night after about 10pm. The loudest part of our stay was actually the staff. Our room was right next to the restaurant so we heard the staff taking out the garbage, transporting dishes, talking (very) loudly to each other, etc. That was pretty disheartening, as it seemed as though they did not care at all about t he fact that paying guests were only separated by a thin wall and open windows. The place could easily be improved: offering the amenities they promise, having better lighting, training the staff to be more accommodating. All in all, however, if you book it at a discount rate, you will be satisfied. We did not eat at the restaurant. The prices seemed a bit high. Also, be prepared to find your own parking. Though there is a parking lot, it was full every night by the time we returned to the hotel around 10pm. The road is very narrow and windy so parking can eat up about 30 additional minutes of your time. We also did not swim in the pool. It looked clean enough but the jacuzzi was not heated.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Relax”
Reviews.Author: texaninatlanta
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short stay here. The view is wonderful - sea, coconut palms, pelicans, sea gulls all right outside your front door... For the price ($105 per night), you will not get a better view. With resort in the name, you may expect fancier rooms. They are not - please don't go for the room. This is a wonderful place to do nothing - relax and read a book, collect shells, bob in the sea, practice your Spanish. The food is very good at the restaurant, the pina colodas are great, and everyone is very friendly. You can explore the tiny towns close by and sample the local culture. If you want nightlife and tourist traps, then this is not for you - stay near San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Music Will Play in Your Head!”
Reviews.Author: dolphingvp
Reviews.Content: Ok itâ€™s a dive. You can't sleep in the rooms because of the road noise. There is nothing to do for miles around, and few places to eat. If you like snorkeling, itâ€™s not bad during the calm wind months. BUT When you spend time sitting there, just endlessly staring across the water into the sunset. I can say without question you will carry that with you forever. The song La Isla Bonita will have a totally new meaning. When ever you hear it played, you will be taken right back to that spot. It is a unique location with a priceless view that is irreplaceable.

Reviews.Title: “Picture-Perfect Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Enter_the_World
Reviews.Content: -Overall- The fact that anyone would write a bad review about this place is astounding to me and my family. I would never even consider staying anywhere else in Puerto Rico! The staff were friendly and helpful, the grounds were tastefully decorated, and everything was meticulously clean. My family would have been happy spending the full five days just hanging out at this resort! Go here if you want to beat the crowds! We went during Spring Break and hardly saw anyone there! The price for this hotel is not bad at all, considering it is a private resort right on the ocean. I don't believe you can find any hotel of this quality at this price anywhere else in Puerto Rico. -Rooms- The rooms were clean and neat. They weren't anything fancy, but they had everything you need. (e.g. a fridge, an airconditioner, a t.v....) The traffic can get a little loud at night, but the air conditioner blocked out most of the noise. Even still, ear plugs wouldn't be a bad idea. When you walk outside in the morning, you will either walk onto a shared belcony or a shared porch. Both are very nice! -Hotel Grounds- The grounds left nothing to be desired! Tall palm trees were all over the place, with comfortable hammocks hanging in between them. The beach was long and wide, with smooth sand and plenty of beach chairs. Guests with ground-level rooms are only feet from the beach! The whole area is beautifully decorated with tropical flowers and plants. The ocean water is warm and clear. The coral reef that dominates the area is teeming with life! I highly reccomend buying some snorkeling gear if you plan on visiting! Although the water isn't as rocky as many people make it sound, it's a good idea to bring water shoes. The ocean is better for snorkeling than swimming. If you'd like to swim, the pool area is private and gorgeous! -Food- The view at the restaraunt is incredible! However, the food is about average. I would reccomend going to one of the local restaraunts for dinner. The Mar de la Tranquilidad was our favorite! -Staff- The staff was always courteous and friendly! They were always willing to help if we needed anything. One day I found a brown coconut that had washed ashore and I was trying to crack it open. One of the staff saw my attempts and told me that the coconut needed to be fresh if you wanted to eat it, he then walked away. A while later, he returned with a lovely green cocunut with the top cut off and two straws in it! He told us that this kind of coconut had a soft, sweet fruit. He then showed us how to cut the fruit off of the shell to eat it easier. What a kind thing to do! -Wildlife- Because this hotel is far away from the bustling city scene, there was a great number of different animals to see. Hermit Crabs can be found crawling on the edges of the beach, Green Anole lizards are everpresent on the trees, larger lizards called Amievas bask in the morning sun, and lightning-fast Sand Crabs stroll along the beach at night. The hotel also has a large pet Iguana caged near the entrance. However, the greatest sighting of the trip was a Manatee rolling in the water right out in front of the hotel! -Conclusion- This small resort gave us the feeling that we were in paradise! Sure, it wasn't perfect. But it was a better experience than I could have ever dreamed of!

Reviews.Title: “Great View and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: travelingman101
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to relax and be near the water this is a great place. My husband and I did not know what to expect, but the reviews were nice so we gave it a chance. The drive from the airport is more like 1 hr 45 min. So if I would do this again, I would stay a few days at Caribe Playa and a few days closer to San Juan. Going back and forth was a little much. The mountain view to Patillas were beautiful. We would recommend not to drive to this resort after 4pm. In October it got dark around 6pm and can be tricky and dangerous driving there after dark. Our room was on the first level, the beach just about at our door. I love to read very early in themorning, so I would enjoy the great water view from a hammack right outside our bedroon door with a cup of coffee. There are also some beach chairs to enjoy. The sand if very rocky, that is the downfall. I did not care for swimming in the area because of the rock s and the water was not real clear. However the view is wonderful, and when we were there, the resort was not that full, so we had a lot of privacy. The pool was nice, so we did our swimming there. We ate twice in the resort. Not bad but on the pricey side. We did most of our eating where the locals eat. There is a mall, movies, Walmart and Walgreeens nearby. The room was no fancy but very nice. The furniture was updated rustic. I did not have a coffee maker, so the office provided me with one. They also give you beach towels and Iron. If you love relaxation, you should love this place. I would viist again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: miraida1
Reviews.Content: I am thank full to my cousin how insisted for us to go to Caribe Playa, I took the wrong way there so it took me about two hours to get there, but when we arrived it was worth it. We arrived pretty late but still they cook for us and the food was very good. When we went to our room all was simple but clean, nice little kitchen looking area, also with cable. But the sound of the ocean while you sleep its priceless. Next day we went to the beach like all people say it's rocky and with corals, but the water it's very clear, nice to swim you would need to wear some water sandals and do bring snorkeling gear. It is very quiet at night but I love it felt like heaven no much car sound just the sound of the ocean. Very happy I stayed in Playa Caribe the staff was super nice, thanks

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and quiet”
Reviews.Author: monicacaguas
Reviews.Content: I was just exploring the area and stopped and booked one night.. Great escape for couples. Beachfront location, the beach is full of rocks but anyway is a nice place. Clean room . Good service. Near there an excellent restaurant..It is a place for people searching peace and a quiet moment. They have to improve parking I have trouble at the time of getting out of the parking there were cars obstructing the exit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It; Didn't want to come home!”
Reviews.Author: fiveinmyfam
Reviews.Content: I'd have to disagree with a lot of the comments that I read. My family was just there second week of April. We had a lovely stay! The hotel was nice and very clean. The staff was very friendly and I thought that the food was very good! (worth the wait) : ) The kids enjoyed the pool and the beach. My husband and I were able to kick back and really enjoy our trip. Yes, you are kind of out in the middle of no where and I wasn't sure of what touristy things there were to do, but isn't that the point??? We loved the seclusion and having the beach at our door step.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: iamkasiaNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply perfect. Adorable, intimate, clean and romantic. I had a HUGE grin when we pulled up, I knew we had finally scored and booked exactly what I wanted. IThe water andw waves literally lap at your doorstep. t is magical, just so idyllic. The beach is gorgeous but swimming is a little hard. The food here was just ok but the PINA COLADAS were the best in all of PR, and only $5. The management was super friendly. After we stayed here we took the coastal road to Fajardo which was also ridiculously beautiful. Stay here, I will definetly be back!

Reviews.Title: “, Nice Getaway”
Reviews.Author: diatom1
Reviews.Content: This is a modest, but pleasant hotel. I have a slight disability (walk with a cane) and I found it easy to get around and the staff helpful and friendly. The beach is feet from our door (room #212..king size bed with sink and refrigerator). If you are looking for night life, excitement etc this is not the place for you...as others have said stay in San Juan. But, if you want to experience "real" Puerto Rico, you might want to start here. Route 3 does go right by the hotel...there is nothing to do about it...but within a few minutes we found some peaceful almost deserted beautiful beaches. Also, one can drive into the mountains north of Patillas for a day. We found ourselves staying close to the hotel for reading and swimming most days. Someone commented that the hotel's food was mediocre. We disagree. We had the best red snapper (Chillo) here and the mofungo was also very good. There are a couple of other options within a 15 minute ride for dinner, but the hotel food was just as good as we found locally.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: ehwicked
Reviews.Content: We chose Puerto Rico because my husband had not been there in 20 years. The staff was very helpful, pleasant and friendly. Luis the manager was accomodating beyond our expectation. Everything was so clean, the crew worked Day and Night @ keeping it clean. Waking up to the sound of the ocean and the light of the sun, that's how I like to start my day. We saw baby turtles as they hatched and burrowed their way out, we helped mother nature guide them back into the water. Make sure you order a Pina colada or two, the young lady there makes the best.When you order food you can enjoy it in the open dinning room, by the beach or in the privacy of your room. I read a review about this resort, yes your room feels a bit humid, Hello is by the beach. I'm glad I didn't let this deter me away. Keep your fancy hotels, we found our piece of heaven in Caribe Playa! You can join us there in May 2008. Thanks you guys. Mr. & Mrs. Rivera

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: enneagram9
Reviews.Content: Found this place in 2003, it was a haven after much rain. Went back in 2007. The room was just as nice and clean, the restaurant was really good - best Mafungo I had just about anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location Versus Faciliies”
Reviews.Author: Roadflyer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at this resort on 19 November 2007. We arrived after driving from the west side of Puerto Rico and lookign to explore the south east coast of the island. Although we arrived after 2:00 pm, our room was not ready. We waited at the bar and ordered from their menu. I recommend you eat at a local restaurant and save yourself the disappointment. We were given room 3 in building 3. The room was spacious, but the furtniture was a bit worn and the A/C unit did not work properly and left the floor wet immediately in front of it. Also, some of the windows by the room door were broken and could be open from the outside. I noticed this problem with most of the rooms in our building. The room had a small fridge and a kitchenette, but the A/C unit was over this area and anything left over the counter would become wet. There is no phone in the rooms, and I could not find one once the office closed for the night. Like most of the rooms in the facility, ours faced the beach. The water was only about 20 feet from our room. There are plenty of beach chairs and hammocks to lay around in the sun. I did not use the pool, but the place has a nice one with an area for kids. Overall the resort is in a great location and makes it easy to explore the coast, but at $117.00 a night we found it way over priced for the overal state of the facility.

Reviews.Title: “No crowds,”
Reviews.Author: sernja2007
Reviews.Content: I liked this place alot! I stayed for TWO WEEKS with a group of people and we loved it. I agree -- it is noisy from road traffic at night because of the way the place sits on a bit of land between the road and the beach. Some nights worse than others. You just need to drink a few more Tequilla sunrises before you turn in for the night! 'Frige in the room, stock up whatever you like. The rooms all open to the quiet beachfront. Wake up in the morning, hear the water, open the door and there is your hammock. ten steps to breakfast out on the deck , hot coffee is waiting, sweet ladies bring you your meals outdoors. Don't be afraid to venture out down the road for dinner. All of us had dinners at several of the local restaurants up & down the road and they serve fresh fish, chicken and local fare. You can walk on the sand in flip flops to the little open air place 100 yards down and it was fine. Nothing to be afraid of. We walked home in the dark, no problems. The management was great and can give information about the local restaurants, it does seem like everything closed on Sundays, and some on Mondays. They celebrate lots of holidays so it's hard to predict the closings. Little bakery down the road was good, pastries, flan, a hot lunch can be had there too. Many of the lovely old houses up and down the road are being renovated and this area is up and coming hot property, I can see the future. Just don't expect luxury rooms here, this is water, sun and no crowds. I brought my paint box and sketch pad and it was me and the iguanas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ever Go There”
Reviews.Author: pais2023
Reviews.Content: The room assigned to us happened to be in a part of the hotel which was very noisy. You have a lot of locals visiting family and friends staying at the hotel and they stayed there all night. They played loud music all night and the people were talking loud into late hours of the morning. I'm a Native to the area and now lived in the US for over 27 years. My father died and we did the funeral in Patillas, which is only 15 minutes from the hotel. One night after the wake, we parked in their main lot where there was only one space available, to our surprise the next morning our rental car's windshield was busted. A coconut had fallen from the palm tree and totally busted it. When we called the police we found out that this was not the first time this had occurred and in fact it was an ongoing problem. After our incident at least 3 other vehicles had been damaged by falling coconuts. The property management never bother to put a sign to warn their guest of a possibility of falling coconut s or debris from the palm trees. Just imagine if a coconut is to hit you while you are walking to your car or lying on a hammock at their so called beach, you would certainly not make it. Management is clearly aware of this problem and contend that they can't find anyone to knock down these dangerous dry coconuts. They never offered to do anything for us and basically ignored us for the rest of our stay. The beach is a rocky shore where you can't even go for a swim and the rooms have a moldy smell.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely for a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: heatherrubia
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before booking our stay. Knowing what to expect is always helpful (thanks Trip Advisor) but I think when you book a 3 star hotel you need to keep your expectations in check. Caribe Playa is a quaint, super cute 30 room hotel. It was very quiet and peaceful as no personal radios are allowed on the beach. We had a double, nicely sized room which suprisingly came with a mini-fridge and kitchen sink. We did have traffic noise in our room (unit #1) as was warned by other reviewers. In the morning you open your door and the beach is at your feet. There is a amply sized wooden deck just off the main house for sun bathing (see photo). The pool was clean and shaded in the afternoons should you want to get out of the sun. The beach is a little rocky but it is nice. As there are no other hotels beside Caribe Playa it is just you neighbors/other guests on the beach. You can pull the lounge chairs right in the water. The grounds are well maintained with hammocks strung between trees should you want to take an afternoon nap. Take the time to walk around the bay and look back at the hotel (beautiful, see photo). We had dinner at the restaurant. They serve typical Puerto Rican food which means most everything is fried, but it was good (large portions, see photo). They serve fantastic coffee in the morning. Mid morning they made us fresh mango coladas which were fabulous. I made several trips back and forth for these drinks while spending a leisurely day on the sun deck. The staff was very polite but on their own time, however a 3 star hotel on an island usually equals a slower pace - you should not be surpirsed by this. At times we felt like we had the place to ourselves which is exactly what we were looking for - seclusion. I live in San Juan and I am always looking for a quick get away from the traffic, noise, and clutter. Caribe Playa is only an hour from San Juan and the second half of the drive has many nice views. We ended our trip on the 3rd of July which was perfect timing because the little hotel was completely booked for the 4th, meaning the secluded feeling was lost somewhat. Absolutely we will return for more inexpensive relaxation and seclusion. We definitely received our money's worth. Next time we will try the massages (you can get an hour massage for only $50!!).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: ElyzabethM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in late April. In some ways the Caribe is outstanding, in other ways, it leaves a bit to be desired. Hope you don't mind reading a long review. We had booked on-line and I had e-mailed to let them know we would be arriving very late, around 11:30. However, due to a problem with our rental car and a traffic delay, we actually arrived at 2:30 AM. I knew no one would be in the office and I was afraid we would be sleeping in the car, however when we walked up to the office in the small hours of the morning, I immediately saw an envelope with my name on it that contained our room key and a nice note asking me to stop by in the morning to check in. Very nice! Yes, this is a long drive from the airport, but you also have to compare the room prices to those around San Juan. The views are beautiful, the hammocks wonderful. This hotel has some of the nicest grounds I've ever seen. The photos don't do it justice. The ocean swimming is pretty average, but safe enough if you stay inside the breakers. We saw some people surfing at little way down the beach so we presume there is some good wave action. The pool was very nice and clean, but the hot tub doesn't actually heat up. We asked about it and were told the heater hadn't been working for some years. The sun deck is a great place to relax and soak up some rays. The rooms are just okay. The decor is average. The bedding and towels are very clean. Two out of three mornings, we didn't get hot water or water pressure. We decided it was probably due to the solar hot water heating and we just slept too late to get any. The last morning we were up early and we had plenty of hot water and water pressure. There was a nice large apartment sized fridge in the room that we stocked up with drinks and snacks (purchased at the local super Wal-Mart), which was great. One thing I thought was funny was the coffee maker; it had a sign next to it inviting us to enjoy a nice cup of Puerto Rican coffee, compliments of the Caribe Playa and advising us we could purchase additional coffee at the office. There was however, no coffee and no coffee cups. No sugar, creamer, etc, either. I don't know if these items could have been obtained, as we're not big coffee drinkers and didn't ask about it. The road noise wasn't an issue as we couldn't actually hear it over the air conditioner. We tried the on-site cafe only once, for lunch. Not all menu items are available at any given time. The food is fairly average, the prices are fairly reasonable. One item we ordered was a club sandwich. We were told that they didn't have any bacon. So, we got the club, no bacon. This ended up being a ham and cheese sandwich. Not great ham or cheese either. Chopped ham and Velveeta type american cheese. The menu had ham & cheese sandwiches for $5 and club sandwiches for $7.50. Guess which price the charged us? The empanadas we ordered were fresh and very tasty, with a nice dipping sauce. We did not try any other local restaurants. There are not very many other restaurants around that looked "safe" to our admittedly americanized tastes. We also saw several roadside vendors selling roasted this or that which smelled wonderful. Since we still had over a week of vacation remaining we didn't want to risk any stomach trouble. My suggestion to anyone going that way would be to go to your family doctor, stock up on some heavy duty stomach remedies and eat everything you can get your hands on, because it all smelled so wonderful I did feel like we were missing out. All in all, we enjoyed out time, but I wouldn't have wanted to spend longer than the three days we were there. If you are looking for some un-commercialized beauty and simple comforts, you will find it at the Caribe Playa.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Place for Real Travelers”
Reviews.Author: enss80
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all of the so-so reviews I've read about the Caribe Playa! My husband and I love this place and would stay there again and again. If you don't know much about Puerto Rico and/ or are a "vacation snob", maybe you should stay around touristy San Juan or spend $600 a night at the Horned Dorset, but if you are a real traveler who doesn't mind a basic room in exchange for beautiful views and a gorgeous location, this could be a good place for you. Yes, the beach is rocky, as are most beaches in southern PR, but still very pretty. Wear water shoes. This isn't Luquillo. But there are plenty of things that make up for it. Dinners were delicious, the pool was always clean, and we didn't have any mildew in our room! And please don't expect things to be like America; PR might be a U.S. possession, but it definitely has its own culture and way of doing things. If you want a vacation that is packaged perfection, go to an all-inclusive instead and let others enjoy undeveloped, undiscovered Patillas.

Reviews.Title: “Caribe Playa captures the essense of the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: MN_traveler033
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews have done a very good job of describing the pros and cons of Caribe Playa. While it is not as luxurious as other accommodations on the island, the setting on the beach is not to be outdone. This is the place for the rugged traveler, willing to compromise comfort for idyllic surroundings. The food at the restaurant was very good. I found the staff to be very accommodating to our requests. My minimal Spanish language skills were helpful, but not necessary. I would also recommend that to reach the hotel from San Juan that the route through Humacao, Yabacoa and around the coast to Maunabo was easier than following Hwy 52 across the island.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Everybody But Could Be For You”
Reviews.Author: Mushiquino
Reviews.Content: Hoping to avoid the swarms of tourists and assorted tourist traps on Puerto Rico, my wife and I looked for something on the Carribean side of the island. The Carribe Playa Beach Resort -- and a rented car to explore the southern part of Puerto Rico -- sounded perfect. Yes, all my Puerto Rican friends shook their heads and asked, "Patillas??? Why are you going to Patillas?" but we stuck with our plan. First, the positives: The photos of this place do not lie.
