Caribe Playa Beach Resort really is right on the beach with some breathtaking views. Palm trees, beautiful water and sunshine we were lucky to have for our four days there -- it all looks too good to be true on the website but the views really are this amazing. There are beach chairs and hammocks all over the place to lounge around on, there is an outdoor restaurant with the same excellent views right there too. The water when we were there (November) was a very swimmable temperature. The staff was for the most part extremely helpful and friendly (more later) and the coffee in this place was excellent. The nicest thing of all isn't so much about this place as it is a commentary about the island -- I have travelled quite a bit and I have never met friendlier people than the people in Puerto Rico. We must have stopped to ask for directions a thousand times, and every time people went out of their way to help us. Strangers smiled at us and said hi. People constantly wished us good morning. There are a lot of people who are nice for the sake of being nice on this island. The not so positives: As long as you are not expecting to be pampered like a spoiled diva, most of the "not so positives" of the Caribe Playa Beach Resort aren't really all that bad. Still, you should know that the restaurant staff tend to take a while with your food, as in a very long time. Also, as many have mentioned, there is some noise from the traffic along the highway, which may disturb light sleepers. (I loved the sound of the surf lulling me to sleep, however). Of particular disappointment to me was the fact that the king size bed we were told we'd have was really just two twin beds stuck together and covered with a king size bed spread and sheets to make it look king size. I really wouldn't have cared if I had had to share a bed with my brother or somebody, but for my honeymoon with my wife, not having a big crack down the middle of our bed would have been nice. The water, while swimmable, is not what you might have in mind when you think, "Ahhh, the Carribean." It has lots of rocks at points and it isn't clear as in snorkeling type water. Lastly, you should know that this place is FAR from the San Juan Airport, so if you have a late arriving flight, you probably won't get in until the middle of the night, and that's if you don't get lost, which we did (rather badly.) The roads on the southern part of the island are in general windy and not always in the best of shape. We ended up going north at times to Fajardo and over to San Juan anyway, where the infrastructure really did seem to be better suited to tourists. Still, we had some great views driving on the Carribean side, particularly going east of Patillas, we met friendly people wherever we were, and despite some construction down there at times as well, we felt good about getting to know the less-known side of the island. It somehow seemed more authentic, which is what we wanted. The only real negative about our stay which really was a shame and knocks this hotel down a couple of notches, was that in the middle of our second night, I awoke to hear my wife shrieking. I sat up in bed quickly -- what was it? A rat? A burglar? No. My wife was stading in a huge puddle of water. She had gotten up to use the bathroom and had instead found that the toilet had not been functioning properly -- it had kept filling its tank continuously without stopping, and had flooded our room. I walked through the water and turned off the toilet (rather proud of myself to figure out to do this after being awakened suddenly at 3 AM) and we used our towels to soak up as much of the water as we could. After the sun came up, I explained the problem to the hotel manager, who agreed to put us in a different room, but in the end, one of the maintenance guys fixed the toilet and we ended up staying in our original room. Not a huge deal, but if I were the manager of a hotel and I wanted people to come back, I would have offered us something -- a free meal at least -- if two of my guests had lost a good night's sleep and not been able to use a bathroom until the morning because one of my toilets didn't work. Instead, I had to pracically beg for this, and explain over and over to skeptical management that it wasn't us who had stopped up or damaged the toilet -- it just didn't work. In the end, they gave us a free dinner. Much appreciated. But if I hadn't complained about it, they would have done nothing. You have to go to Caribe Playa Beach Resort -- and the southern side of Puerto Rico -- with the mentality that even though it's the U.S., it's in many ways a foreign country, with all its positives and all its charm, as well as it's inconveniences that might annoy you when you aren't used to them. If you keep that in mind and are okay with that, then this place will be just fine for you (and also if you feel that toilets are overrated.)

Reviews.Title: “Warm wine, cold water”
Reviews.Author: agnes15547
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night only and we woke up more tired than you can imagine. The motel (wouldn't call it hotel) was overpriced and noisy. We went to upstairs restaurant were we ordered some drinks. I ordered frozen margarita (very tasty), my husband ordered a glass of red wine. It was WORM and tasteless. Other problems we had were limited towels (one per person), cold water in the shower, barking (entire night !!!) owner's dog, very and I mean VERY noisy street, instead of regular windows some foil cover. The only thing I enjoyed was breathtaking view.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend with inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Caribe Playa Beach Resort in June of 2006. The view of this place is totally AMAZING! The pictures on the internet from the beach are exactly how it is, even better. However, the service and the place are something different. We believe that the rooms are outdated, and are overpriced. It's more like a family camp site where you pay $50.00/day than a hotel. Even more, we wouldn't call it a hotel, is more like a Motel. The staff of the motel do not have any training in customer service. They really don't care if you are satisfied or not. The beaches are just for you to enjoy it with your eyes. They are rocky and dangerous beaches. We had to go to another beach 15 min away from the place and pay to use it. The parking space is very, very limited and sometimes you have to park on the road and if you get lucky to find a space it could get blocked by other cars. As a result of this, you will have to wait for the motel staff to call every room to have them take out the cars. To eat at the hotel you have to make reservations an hour before they start serving and you have to pick between two dishes. The food is not good at all. For tourists, is really a bad representation of our cuisine. When we received our dinner the meat was completely raw and they had to cook it again. Overall, we had a good time not because the motel and the staff did something to make our stay better, but because we tried not to think in all the inconvenients that we had. If we are in the area again some other time, we would not stay in this place and definetely not recommend it to anyone. Maybe just to drive by and take pictures of the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Room liveable, management should be shot twice and then shot again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recenlty purchased by a local rich guy that lives in San Juan, he let his son run the hotel. Juvenile, immature and unable to handle the simplest problems. Fortunately, an older more mature manager had just been recently hired to give the kid some lessons. All I can say is THANK GOD! The hotel has 3 units, one which had no running hot water. I watched for hours while waiting for cheeseburger has one after another customer came to complain about the hot water situation. The young lady who was in "charge" had no idea what that meant and certainly could not handle the unhappy group. She finally refused to answer questions or call anyone to take care of the water heater. About 90 minutes into my hamburger order, a young man, the "manager" showed up for about 5 minutes, listened to some complaints, got his dinner and left. That was the first and last of him. Another 90 minutes later, I got my hamburger. I was the first to order and the very last to eat. Good burger though. The rooms are nothing special. You have no choice but to use the AC because the windows have plastic covering them. Only the bathroom let in outside air. Phones? Well, maybe, maybe not. The saving grace was the older gentlemen that we met the next morning. Professional, courteous, and MATURE. It was a travesty when we found out that many of the people could have been moved to other units, but the young lady and her "boss" seemed totally indifferent about it. If the girl and kid are gone, this might be a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Restful and Sunny”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our families of two daughters,sons-in-laws,and three grand daughters. The rooms were clean,the bathrooms a little out of date,but for the most part clean. Any problems that arose were quickly taken care of. The main problem is the main road right in front of the hotel. the noise of the traffic which is at its worse between five in the morning untill you get up (quite early) was the main set back. It is at least an hour and a half from most major cities. A very good place to relax and enjoy the water and pool. The restraunt is quaint,average prices and the food is okay. You just have a long wait to receive your meals. We found this to be the case in most of the resraunts in the area. Would we go back,maybe. It is just the way it is advertised on line,so if you want a restful vacation,and plan on not doing much this is the place. If you want to see and be on the go,I would look else where. Our stay was 4/17/06 to 4/22/06. A.Calling,Meriden.Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “Beuttiful place--Bad Food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a 2 hour ride from San Juan we found the place. We wanted to find the Bar but they don't have one. We sat in the resturant which is very nice and ordered drinks. It was very dark we could not see how lovely this place was. The rooms are one step up from camping out Very old and dirty. When we woke up in the morning I thought I was in paradice.You are so close to the water,the beach and pool are great. Not only is the food at the motel bad but it is also terrible at all the local resturants.This is not a tourist area and you don't feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked 9 nights at this place via a travel site on the internet- with no refunds after I checked in- big mistake! The place is ok, don't get me wrong. The views are breath taking, and the grounds are tastfully decorated. The staff here is wonderful, and I give them an A+ in service. The food at the restaurant is good, but dinner choices are usually limted to 2, and you need to make a reservation at least an hour ahead of time- places to eat in the area are limted Monday- Thursday, so keep that in mind. The road noise gets to you - they are right next to route 3, a busy route. We couldn't use the pool, because it was dirty, and looked like it needed some chemicals added to it. We stayed 5 nights, and had had enough- so we left and didn't get a refund for the remaining nights. Next time I book a place that I don't know about, I will only do a few nights, and stay longer if I like it- lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 small children (3 and 5 year old), and my parents stayed at Caribe Playa in April 2005 for 4 nights. I would not recommend this place to anyone, but especially to people with children. The hotel is very far from the airport (about 3 hours), the road to get there is dangerous and poorly marked, and the hotel is hard to find. It is located right next to the busy road with no land in between. There is nothing to dampen the noise from cars and trucks going by. It is very isolated. There are no restaurants nearby. The nearest and only supermarket is 30 minutes away by car. The hotel restaurant is overpriced and has nothing on the menu for children. There are only 2 menu options for dinner, and the whole time we were there we didn't find it inspiring. You have to let them know whether you will be eating dinner there well in advance, or you are out of luck. Although the hotel is right on the beach, the property is extremely narrow and the beach is rocky and dangerous. You are allowed to swim in the tiny stretch of the beach as there deadly undercurrents right next to the swimming area. The rooms are very outdated, worse than motel quality. You do get a a refrigerator and a coffee maker in the room. We stocked the fridge with bread, cheese, coffee, and fruit from the supermarket and considered ourselves lucky not to have to use the hotel restaurant. I would never again stay in a place that is so isolated from everything else. There are many more places in Puerto Rico with better property and location.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. Beautiful views. Room small but clean. For part of the stay we were 1 group of 3 so we had the place pretty much to ourselvess. The grounds were perfect and very well kept. Very peaceful. Didn't like having to have a reservation to eat in their outdoor place but there was a nice place to eat up the road where they had fresh everything. You need a car to get around, this is the real Puerto Rico mostly locals. Didn't see too many tourists. It's not a grand place but a cute little hideaway with lots of privacy. It was so relaxing I didn't want to go home.

HotelInfo.Name: Caribe Playa Beach Resort
HotelInfo.Address: Road # 3, Km 112.1, Patillas 00723, Puerto Rico
